Summary: (initially) group of pulsing red lights (later sin
divs: Sighting DetailsWas watching TV that was placed in front of window. Nine objects in squareformation initially seen through one window approaching from SW. Speed roughlyequal to a fast or low flying aircraft, although silent. Emitted red lightfading in and out approx. once per second. Seen through first window for lessthan approximately three seconds. Seen through net curtain which may haverefracted light but not normally the case. Ran to front of house, saw firstthrough upper floor window and then by naked eye outside. Thought initially itwas an aircraft, but it did not have white flashing lights (legal requirement?),only pulsing red. Seen through second window and with naked eye, where onebright pulsing red light and two or possibly three dimmer lights surrounding it.It moved at a steady speed NE until it dissappeared behind the horizon, indirection of Whitstable.(it may be of interest that the supposed Aurora planewas seen over the town toward which it was headed a year or so ago)
trends: There have been no other sightings in Whitstable
This sighting has never been favorited.
